alert.note: Alert for Bienville; Bossier; Caddo; Claiborne; De Soto; Red River; Webster (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 02 at 8:20PM CDT until April 02 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT FOR WEBSTER...NORTH CENTRAL DE SOTO...NORTHEASTERN RED RIVER... SOUTHEASTERN CADDO...SOUTHWESTERN CLAIBORNE...WESTERN BIENVILLE AND SOUTHEASTERN BOSSIER PARISHES... At 819 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Dixie Inn to near Doyline to 8 miles southeast of Haughton to 10 miles northeast of Stonewall, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. At 749 pm, a 73 mph wind gust was measured at the Shreveport Regional Airport. Nickel size hail also fell in the Southern Hills area of South Shreveport. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Shreveport, Bossier City, Minden, Haughton, Ringgold, Sibley, Cotton Valley, Doyline, Dubberly, Dixie Inn, Heflin, Eastwood, Fosters, Martin, Evergreen, Hall Summit, Jamestown, Curtis, Fillmore and Bodcau. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for northwestern Louisiana. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Bienville; Bossier; Caddo; Claiborne; De Soto; Red River; Webster
